content: This speaks volumes to why I consider farcebook possibly the greatest evil ever conceived: anyone in an extended family or other group of acquaintances who is not hardwired into that hacker’s global spy network, is treated as not worth calling, writing to or visiting, as if the human race had somehow been unable to maintain contact all these millennia, before some sociopath looking for a way to harass girls who wouldn’t date his little nerd fratboy pals struck it rich by making us forget how to reach out to one another.
